briefdescription.para: number of seconds to wait for ZDO responses before timing out

detaileddescription.para: state is the name of a wpan_ep_state_t global used to track the ZDO endpoint's state. Can't just have the state declared in zigbee_zdo.c since a device with multiple XBee modules, will need multiple ZDO wpan_ep_state_t globals.

memberdef.name: zdo_send_response

briefdescription.para: Send a response to a ZDO request.

detaileddescription.para: Automatically builds the response envelope and sets its cluster ID (to the request's cluster ID with the high bit set) before sending.

memberdef.argsstring: (void *buffer, int16_t buflen, uint16_t addr_of_interest, uint16_t profile_id, const uint16_t *inClust, const uint16_t *outClust)
memberdef.name: zdo_match_desc_request

briefdescription.para: Generate a Match_Desc (Match Descriptor) request (ZigBee spec 2.4.3.1.7) to send on the network.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the first byte of buffer is NOT set, and that the caller should set it to the next sequence number/transaction ID.

parameterdescription.para: Size of buffer used to hold generated request.
Profile ID to match, must be an actual profile ID (cannot be WPAN_APS_PROFILE_ANY).
List of input clusters, ending with WPAN_CLUSTER_END_OF_LIST. Can use NULL if there aren't any input clusters.
List of output clusters, ending with WPAN_CLUSTER_END_OF_LIST. Can use NULL if there aren't any output clusters.
buffer isn't large enough to hold request; need 7 bytes plus (2 * the number of clusters)
number of bytes written to buffer

briefdescription.para: Given a device's IEEE (64-bit) address, get its 16-bit network address by unicasting a ZDO NWK_addr request to it.

detaileddescription.para: After calling this function, *net is set to ZDO_NET_ADDR_PENDING.
When a SUCCESS response comes back, *net is set to the 16-bit network address in the response.
When an ERROR response comes back, *net is set to ZDO_NET_ADDR_ERROR.
If a timeout occurs waiting for a response, *net is set to ZDO_NET_ADDR_TIMEOUT.
(So the caller needs to wait until (*net != ZDO_NET_ADDR_PENDING)).

parameterdescription.para: IEEE address (in big-endian byte order) of device we're seeking a network address for
location to store the 16-bit network address when the NWK_addr response comes back.
conversation table is full, wait and try sending later

briefdescription.para: Given a device's 16-bit network address, get its IEEE (64-bit) address by unicasting a ZDO IEEE_addr request to it.

detaileddescription.para:
This function only works with the following XBee firmware versions:
S2C: 401F and later (ZigBee), 5123 and later (Smart Energy)
S2[B]: not supported
After calling this function, *ieee_be is set to *ZDO_IEEE_ADDR_PENDING.
When a SUCCESS response comes back, *ieee_be is set to the 64-bit IEEE address in the response.
If an ERROR response comes back, *ieee_be is set to all zeros (*ZDO_IEEE_ADDR_ERROR).
If a timeout occurs waiting for a response, *ieee_be is set to ZDO_IEEE_ADDR_TIMEOUT.

parameterdescription.para: network address of device we're seeking an IEEE address for
location to store the 64-bit IEEE address when the IEEE_addr response comes back.
conversation table is full, wait and try sending later

memberdef.argsstring: (wpan_envelope_t *envelope, uint16_t addr_of_interest, uint_fast8_t endpoint, wpan_response_fn callback, const void FAR *context)
memberdef.name: zdo_simple_desc_request

briefdescription.para: Send a ZDO Simple Descriptor Request.

detaileddescription.para: The simple descriptor contains information specific to each of a node's endpoints. Use the ZDO Simple Descriptor Request to get a descriptor for an endpoint on a remote node.

parameterdescription.para: Envelope created with wpan_envelope_create(). Only dev, ieee_address and network_address should be set, all other structure elements should be zero. Address may match addr_of_interest or an alternative device that contains the discovery information of that device (like an end device's parent).
Network address of the device for which the simple descriptor is required.
Endpoint of interest, a value from 1 to 254.
Function to receive the Simple Descriptor Response. See documentation for wpan_response_fn for this callback's API.
Context pointer passed to the callback along with the response.

memberdef.argsstring: (wpan_envelope_t *envelope, uint16_t type, wpan_response_fn callback, void FAR *context)
memberdef.name: zdo_send_bind_req

briefdescription.para: Send a ZDO Bind (or Unbind) Request to the destination address in the envelope.

detaileddescription.para: Binds .dest_endpoint on .ieee_address to .source_endpoint on .dev using .cluster_id.
Ignores the .options, .payload, and .length members of the envelope.

parameterdescription.para: addressing information used for the Bind Request
ZDO_BIND_REQ for a Bind Request or ZDO_UNBIND_REQ for an Unbind Request; all other values are invalid
callback to receive Bind/Unbind (or Default) Response; NULL if you don't care about the response

briefdescription.para: Send a ZDO Management Leave Request.

parameterdescription.para: address to send request to, or NULL for self-addressed

one or more of the following flags:
ZDO_MGMT_LEAVE_REQ_FLAG_NONE
ZDO_MGMT_LEAVE_REQ_FLAG_REMOVE_CHILDREN - set the Remove Children flag in the ZDO request
ZDO_MGMT_LEAVE_REQ_FLAG_REJOIN - set the Rejoin flag in the ZDO request
ZDO_MGMT_LEAVE_REQ_ENCRYPTED - send the request with APS encryption

memberdef.argsstring: (wpan_envelope_t *envelope, uint16_t cluster, uint16_t addr_of_interest, wpan_response_fn callback, const void FAR *context)
memberdef.name: zdo_send_descriptor_req

briefdescription.para: Send a ZDO Node, Power, Complex or User Descriptor request, or an Active Endpoint request.

parameterdescription.para: Envelope created by wpan_envelope_create; this function will fill in the cluster and reset the payload and length.

Any ZDO request with a transaction and 16-bit network address as its only fields, including:
ZDO_NODE_DESC_REQ
ZDO_POWER_DESC_REQ
ZDO_ACTIVE_EP_REQ
ZDO_COMPLEX_DESC_REQ
ZDO_USER_DESC_REQ
address to use in ZDO request
context to pass to callback with response

briefdescription.para: ZigBee Device Objects (ZDO) and ZigBee Device Profile (ZDP).
